You can create as many folders as you want to organize your applications.
Click on the icon or name of a folder to change it, the pen allows to edit the folder content.
If a folder is removed, its content will be put back in the main applications list.
These buttons allow you to export the application data (favorites, shortcuts and settings) or to import a previous export.
Be careful: if you edit this file, it may produce unexpected results!
(With Android Oreo (8) or higher, imported web applications may not work because they are managed by the system and are not supposed to be exported)

From the home screen, swipe down to display the favorites panel and swipe up to hide it. 
 
If you swipe up when the favorites panel is hidden, it will display the complete list of applications. Swipe down from the top of this list to come back to the home screen. 
 
Press the button below the favorites panel to display the menu of the launcher. 
 
If you hold your finger a few moments on an application or a folder, you will be offered to access its settings.

The list of applications and their icons are refreshed only after some events (on start, when an application is added or removed, if the icon pack is modified). When this happens, a small popup message appears during a few moments. \n \nIf something does not feel right, you should try to refresh the applications list manually.

You can create as many folders as you want to organize your applications. These folders can also be added in favorites. If a folder is removed, its content will be put back in the main applications list. \n \nAn application can be in only one folder at a time (or not in a folder). However, you can have both an application and the folder containing this application in favorites.
